main-form.footer: Rega HIV subtyping tool V.3 is maintained by: Tulio de Oliveira, Pieter Libin, Koen Deforche, Sharon Cassol and Anne-Mieke Vandamme.

start-form.title: REGA HIV Subtyping Tool Version 3.0
start-form.note:
This tool is designed to use phylogenetic methods in order to identify the subtype of a specific sequence. The sequence is analysed for recombination using bootscanning methods.
Note for batch analysis: The REGA subtype tool accepts up to {1} sequences at a time.

howToCite-form.title: How to Cite the REGA HIV-1 Automated Subtyping Tool

howToCite-text.text:
These REGA HIV-1 subtyping tool version 3 is not yet published.
In the moment please cite the usage of REGA HIV-1 subtyping tool as originally published:
An Automated Genotyping System for Analysis of HIV-1 and other Microbial Sequences.
de Oliveira T,Deforche K, Cassol S, Salminem M, Paraskevis D, Seebregts C, Snoeck J, van Rensburg EJ,Wensing AMJ, van de Vijver DA, Boucher CA, Camacho R and Vandamme A-M.
Bioinformatics 2005; 21 (19), 3797-3800.
To cite the others subtyping and genotyping tools (e.g. HCV, HBV, HPV, HTLV-1 and HHV8) please use the reference:
A Standardized Framework for Accurate, High-throughput Genotyping of Recombinant and Non-recombinant Viral Sequences .
Alcantara LCJ, Cassol S, Libin P, Deforche K, Pybus OG, Van Ranst M, Galvao-Castro B, Vandamme A-M and de Oliveira T.
Nucleic Acids Research 2009; doi: 10.1093/nar/gkp455, pages 1-9.
You can also see papers that cite Rega HIV-1 subtyping tool in google scholar.

tutorial-text.text:
The report contains three main parts: HIV-1 Subtype analysis, CRFs analysis, and Bootscanning (or Phylogenetic signal) analysis. The first two areas, show the phylogenetic trees constructed with pure subtypes (part one) and CRFs forms (part two). For sequences with more than 1.000 bp a bootscanning analysis is performed and a graphical result displayed, for sequences below 1.000 bp the bootscanning is replaced by phylogenetic signal analysis to determine if the alignment is well suitable for phylogenetic analysis.
Multiple sequences can be submitted to the REGA HIV-1 subtyping tool.
The batch report (figure1) will be the batch report and contain information on the sequence name, length, assigned subtype and a figure of the HIV-1 genome. Accessing the report link will take the user to a report to each submitted sequence.

The sequence report (figure 2) will be composed of three areas named: sequence assignment, analysis details and phylogenetic analyses.
The Sequence assignment contains information on:
the sequence submitted (name and length),
the classification assignment (subtype, subgroup and bootstrap support),
a graphical representation of the HIV-1 genome showing the genomic region of the query sequence with the start and end positions related to the HXB2 genome,
the motivation of the classification (this is based on the decision tree).
The Phylogenetic analysis section contains:
the phylogenetic tree in PDF and Nexus format,
the log file generated by PAUP (contains info on the model of evolution and its parameters),
the alignment used.

decisionTrees-text.header: Decision Tree for sequences longer than 800 bp
decisionTrees-text.rule: Subtype assigned based on sequence > 800 bps, clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap > 70% without recombination in the bootscan, and do not clustering with a CRF with bootstrap >70 %.

Subtype assigned based on sequence > 800 bps, clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap > 70% without recombination in the bootscan, clustering with a CRF with bootstrap >70 % however not clustering inside the CRF cluster.

Subtype assigned based on sequence > 800 bps, clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap > 70% without recombination in the bootscan, clustering with a CRF with bootstrap >70 % and clustering inside the pure subtype cluster.

Subtype unassigned based on sequence > 800bp, clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap >70 %, with detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan, and failure to classify as a CRFs (bootstrap support).

Subtype unassigned based on sequence > 800bp, clustering with a pure subtype and CRF with bootstrap >70 %, with detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan, and failure to classify as a CRFs (bootscan support).

Subtype assigned based on sequence > 800bp, clustering with a CRF with bootstrap > 70%,with detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan, and further confirmed as a CRF by bootscan analysis.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence > 800bp, do not clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap >70 %, with no detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence > 800bp, do not clustering with a pure subtype or CRF with bootstrap >70 %, with detection of recombination.

Subtype unassigned based on sequence > 800bp, clustering with a CRF with bootstrap > 70%,with detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan, and failure to classify as a CRFs (bootscan support).
Subtype assigned based on sequence > 800bp, clustering with a CRF with bootstrap > 70%,with detection of recombination in the pure subtype bootscan, and further confirmed by CRF by bootscan analysis.
decisionTrees-text.header: Decision Tree for sequences shorter than 800 bp
decisionTrees-text.rule: Subtype unassigned based on sequence < 800bp, do not clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap >70 %.
Subtype unassigned based on sequence < 800bp, clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap > 70%, however not clustering inside the pure subtype cluster.
Subtype assigned based on sequence < 800bp, clustering with a pure subtype with bootstrap > 70%, and clustering inside the pure subtype cluster

text.b: The subtyping process consists of four steps:

ul.li: The initial step involves construction of a phylogenetic tree using HKY distance method in PAUP* software.The alignment contains the sequence under query and group M pure reference sequences for subtypes A-D, F-H, J and K A to K.
The next step, involves construction of a second tree using the sequence under query, HIV-1 pure subtypes, and CRFs sequences.
In the third step, the sequence under query sequence is divided into small segments and is analysed for recombination using bootscanning using a sliding window of 400 bps moving in steps of 50 bps.
Finally, in the fourth step, the alignment is examined to determine whether it contains sufficient phylogenetic signals for subtype determination using Treepuzzle software.

contactUs-form.title: Contact the developers of the REGA HIV-1 & 2 subtyping tool

contactUs-text.text:
The REGA HIV-1 Subtyping tool was developed by a number of researchers; please see the complete list of authors in the publications associated with the tool. The tool is currently maintained by Tulio de Oliveira, Pieter Libin, Koen Deforche, Sharon Cassol and Anne-Mieke Vandamme.
Suggestions or problems on the program please contact:
Dr Tulio de Oliveira
Senior Bioinformatics Researcher
Africa Centre for Health and Population Studies
Nelson R Mandela School of Medicine
University of KwaZulu-Natal
Durban, South Africa.
Tel: +27 35 550 7531
Fax: +27 35 550 7565
Websites: www.bioafrica.net www.africacentre.ac.za
